page.title: 01BAWDSEY / FELIXSTOWE FERRY
page.content: The square is dominated by the mouth of the River Deen. To the south the land is mainly a golf course. The coastal margin is open to the public and is a haven for a number of rare plants. At the mouth of the river is a run down boat yard and the Felixstowe Yatch Club. the boats are stacked on raised sea defences. Fresh fish is sold from stalls in the boat yard. An open ferry runs across the mouth of the river during the summer. At the mouth of the river, the land is sheltered and provides a mooring place for private boats. To the north the land is dominated by large open grain fields. The land is very flat and protected from flooding by embankments. The RAF has a station at Bawdsey Manor, 85 squadron is based there. It is a bloodhound surface to air missile station.
